alert.note: Alert for Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 5:30AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PASQUOTANK...CAMDEN... PERQUIMANS...CURRITUCK...AND SOUTHERN CHOWAN COUNTIES AND THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF VIRGINIA BEACH THROUGH 615 AM EST... At 529 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Moyock to near Chapanoke to near Westover. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Virginia Beach, Elizabeth City, Camden, Hertford, Elizabeth City State University, Burgess, Snug Harbor, Cape Colony, Nixonton, and Moyock around 535 AM EST. Currituck and Whitehall Shores around 540 AM EST. Weeksville, Knotts Island, and Indiantown around 545 AM EST. Shiloh around 550 AM EST. Old Trap around 600 AM EST. Corolla around 605 AM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bob White Fork, Drummond Point, Pierceville, Saint Johns, Parkville, Tar Corner, Glen Cove, Hancock, Yeopim Station, and Gregory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Camden; Chowan; Eastern Currituck; Pasquotank; Perquimans; Western Currituck
